mutt_bhojan.serving: Patravali (dried leaf plates) or banana leaf
characteristics: Always vegetarian and sattvic (no onion, no garlic)
Moderate oil usage, ghee served separately
Balanced meal with protein (dal/kosambari), carbs (rice), fiber (palya)
typical_items: Puliyogare OR Chitranna OR Tomato rice (flavored rice)
visual_cues: Overlapping dried leaves as plate (brown/beige colored leaves)
Rice in center, sides arranged around periphery
mutt_bhojan.glycemic_notes: Moderate-high due to rice volume. Mitigated by dal protein and fiber from palya/kosambari.

puliyogare.visual: Brownish-orange rice, visible peanuts, tamarind-coated grains

chitranna.visual: Yellow rice with turmeric tint, peanuts, curry leaves

bisi_bele_bath.visual: Brown-orange wet rice mixed with dal, vegetables

kosambari.visual: Soaked split moong/chana dal mixed with grated coconut, cucumber, coriander
kosambari.notes: High protein, good fiber. One of the healthiest items in a mutt meal.

palya.visual: Dry stir-fried vegetable — green beans, cabbage, beetroot, etc.

chutney_pudi.visual: Dry powder — reddish-brown (with red chillies) or greenish-yellow (with coriander/dill)
chutney_pudi.notes: Eaten mixed with rice and ghee. Peanut/sesame based = more nutritious.

tove_dal.visual: Yellow liquid — toor dal or moong dal, seasoned with mustard, curry leaves

rasam.visual: Thin reddish-brown soup with pepper, tomato

visual_confusions.rice_on_leaf_is_NOT_dosa: If you see loose rice grains on a leaf plate with multiple small sides, it's a thali/mutt meal. Dosa is a SINGLE large golden-brown CREPE.
visual_confusions.yellow_dal_is_NOT_kheer: If it's thin/liquid and savory = dal/tove. If thick, sweet, with cardamom = payasa/kheer.
visual_confusions.chutney_pudi_is_NOT_spice_mix: Dry powder served as a side = chutney pudi, meant to be mixed with rice + ghee.
